links.title: Rumor: Buyback 'blackouts' mean weak stocks. Fact: Not really
links.description: Scott Eells | Bloomberg | Getty Images Earnings season is upon us, and once again there are dire warnings that stocks will be weak because companies are entering a "blackout period" where they will not be able to buy back their stock.

links.title: US stock futures point to another drop on Thursday as October stock-market rout continues
links.description: Overnight Dow Jones industrial average futures fell by 105 points, as of 8:41 p.m. ET, signaling the October stock market drop that intensified on Wednesday could continue on Thursday. Futures implied the Dow will open Thursday down by 196.74 points.

message.body: What happened the last time the S&P500 fell 3%? http://crackedmarket.com/2018/10/what-happened-the-last-time-we-fell-3/ $SPY $SPX $ES_F $QQQ $IWM $AAPL $AMZN

links.title: What happened the last time we fell 3%?
links.description: Free After-Hours Update: The S&P 500 was murdered Wednesday, collapsing 3.3% as the market plunged for the fifth-consecutive session as interest rate fears spiraled out of control. This was the worst down-day since last February's selloff. While that sounds dreadful, could this actually be a good thing?
